channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Work and Income wrong on benefits and redundancies for decades
item.description: Work and Income appears to have spent decades wrongly advising some benefit applicants that they cannot get support until their redundancy has run out.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand and around the world on 9 May
item.description: New Zealand reported two new cases of Covid-19 on Saturday, but a just-released document says the country could remain in alert levels 2 and 3 for years.

item.title: Pilots ask for tax relief to help those who have lost jobs
item.description: Pilots made redundant in the Covid-19 outbreak say the government needs to consider tax relief for many like them who cannot access the benefit.

item.title: Wellington Water calls on council to relax performance targets
item.description: Wellington's water contractor suggested the Wellington City Council might like to relax some of the performance targets for its pipe network if it wanted the contractor to start meeting them.

item.title: Increase in bird life during lockdown may be lost once people return
item.description: Ornithologists believe birds - which have been more visible in parks and public spaces - could abandon them once people start to come back.

item.title: How to talk to conspiracy theorists and anti-vaxxers
item.description: As conspiracy theories spring up around Covid-19, Professor Julie Leask discusses how to speak to those who tout them, and what pushes people towards believing them.

item.title: Alert levels two and three could be in place for 'moderate amount of time'
item.description: New Zealand could remain in alert levels 2 and 3 for a "moderate amount of time" even if infection prevention and control continue, according to an official document.

item.title: Two new cases of Covid-19 linked to St Margarets cluster
item.description: There have been two new cases of Covid-19 reported in NZ today, both linked to the St Margarets cluster in Auckland.

item.title: Construction starts up again at public housing work sites
item.description: Builders are back in business as the construction of state houses and affordable homes ramps up again.

item.title: NZ Music Awards 2020: Country music finalists announced
item.description: The finalists for 2020 Best Country Music Artist and Best Country Music Song have been announced.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates from NZ and around the world
item.description: The French military has flown a three-month old baby from French Polynesia to NZ for urgent surgery. See how the rest of the day's developments unfolded with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: Month in quarantine bars Brisbane-based man's bid to see dying mum
item.description: A New Zealand man living in Brisbane has given up hope of seeing his dying mother in Auckland because he can't afford to be put in mandatory quarantine on both sides of the Tasman.

item.title: Police pursue stolen milk truck in South Auckland
item.description: A woman has been arrested for allegedly stealing a milk truck in South Auckland this morning.

item.title: Royal Commission investigating Christchurch mosque attacks needed extension despite lockdown
item.description: Official documents show the Royal Commission investigating the Christchurch mosque shootings wasn't on track to meet its April deadline before the country went into lockdown.

item.title: Covid-19: NZer in quarantine appeals to government compassion to see dying wife
item.description: A Christchurch man is pleading for government officials to exempt him from quarantine so that he can see his dying wife one last time.

item.title: Covid-19: Government releases hundreds of documents on its response
item.description: The government has released a wealth of material related to its response to the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Epidemic Response Committee discusses immigration
item.description: The Epidemic Response Committee is continuing this afternoon to examine the government's Immigration Amendment bill.

item.title: Covid-19: What will alert level 2 look like? NZ will find out more today
item.description: Today New Zealanders will find out what life will look like if Cabinet agrees to loosen lockdown restrictions next week.
